meanings.definition: Not romantic; lacking in romance or romantic qualities.
meanings.sent1: The movie was unromantic, focusing more on action scenes than love stories.
meanings.sent2: Their relationship was unromantic, with no candlelit dinners or romantic gestures.
meanings.sent3: It was unromantic how he proposed to her in the middle of a fast-food restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The city's skyline looked unromantic under the harsh fluorescent lights.
meanings.sent5: The unromantic setting of the office made it hard for any love stories to blossom.

meanings.definition: Lacking in imagination or idealism; practical or realistic.
meanings.sent1: Her unromantic approach to problem-solving always yielded efficient results.
meanings.sent2: The unromantic design of the building focused more on functionality than aesthetics.
meanings.sent3: It was unromantic how he proposed a spreadsheet to organize their vacation plans.
meanings.sent4: The unromantic nature of the budget cuts left little room for creative solutions.
meanings.sent5: His unromantic view of the world made him a reliable and grounded individual.
